entry.title: Frenetic Shooter 'Ev.io' Lets You Earn Solana While Fragging Enemies
entry.summary: REVIEW: Ev.io is a free-to-play, web-based game that recalls arena shooter classics like Quake, but with a play-to-earn twist via Solana.

entry.title: Putin Signs Digital Ruble Bill Into Law, Priming Russian CBDC for Launch
entry.summary: Russia’s central bank will begin tests for the digital ruble starting on August 1 after receiving Putin’s blessing.

entry.title: 'Ev.io' Game Review: Earn Solana While Blasting Enemies
entry.summary: Ev.io is a web-based first-person shooter that's free to play, but lets NFT holders earn in-game currency that can be redeemed for Solana (SOL). Decrypt contributor Ryan Gladwin shares his review of the fun throwback to Quake-style blasting, albeit with a modern crypto twist.

entry.title: Worldcoin Launch Supply Mostly Made of Market Maker Loans
entry.summary: A digital assets product manager said the agreement was “easy money” for market makers.

entry.title: FOMO-Fueled AI Market Bull Run is Unsustainable, Analyst Says
entry.summary: The CIO of Main Street Research says both retailers and institutions are on a market spree—but the intoxicating effects of the AI drug may fade.

entry.title: Bitcoin Halving Is Less Than 40,000 Blocks Away—Here's What That Means
entry.summary: Bitcoin miners and enthusiasts celebrate another milestone for the network—the 800,000th block mined—as it approaches another halving event.

entry.title: OpenAI Quietly Shuts Down Its AI Detection Tool
entry.summary: Dashing the hopes of educators, OpenAI decommissions its AI Classifier due to poor accuracy.

entry.title: Investors Change Course and Pull Money Out of Bitcoin Funds—But Likely Remain Bullish
entry.summary: But the outflows are minor and don’t necessarily mean investors are less interested, CoinShares told Decrypt.

entry.title: Bored of Hamsters Already? Degens Are Now Betting Crypto on Snails, Rats and Rabbits
entry.summary: There are five members of the animal kingdom represented by tokens on Coingecko: Hamsters, snails, rabbits, horses, and rats. And, confusingly: Marbles.

entry.title: 'Deadrop' Beginner's Guide: How to Dominate in Dr. Disrespect's Shooter
entry.summary: Deadrop has a sharp skill curve, but GG has hard-won tips to help accelerate your journey to the top in this vertical extraction shooter.

entry.title: Bitcoin IRL: Here Are All the Real-Life Tributes to Satoshi Nakamoto's Invention
entry.summary: Artists and hobbyists have found physical ways to pay tribute to Bitcoin's ones and zeros. Here's a look at some of the biggest monuments.

entry.title: These Are the High-Profile Spot Bitcoin ETF Applications Currently in Play
entry.summary: Bitcoin exchange-traded funds have sprung up around the world—but the U.S. SEC has made slow progress towards approval of a Bitcoin spot ETF.

entry.title: Sam Bankman-Fried Might Have Leaked Caroline's Diary, But Lawyers Say 'He's Done Nothing Wrong'
entry.summary: SBF's lawyers complained that newly-appointed FTX CEO, John J. Ray III, has been "routinely and gratuitously attacking" his predecessor.

entry.title: Twitter's 'X' Rebrand: All the Things Elon Musk Has Planned for the 'Everything App'
entry.summary: Open-source code, in-app payments, and a new logo? Here's what Tesla CEO Elon Musk plans for Twitter post-takeover.

entry.title: Worldcoin Has 'Major Issues' and Will Take Years to Work, Vitalik Buterin Warns
entry.summary: Worldcoin has finally launched, but Vitalik Buterin doesn't think everyone will be able to get a World ID—and if they do, they might be misused.

entry.title: Bitcoin Hits Monthly Low Amid Uncertainty Ahead of Fed Meeting
entry.summary: With markets anticipating yet another rate hike this week from the Federal Reserve, Bitcoin fell back below $30,000

entry.title: Crypto Exchanges Line Up to List Worldcoin’s Newly Launched WLD Token
entry.summary: Binance, Bybit, Huobi, OKX, and Gate crypto exchanges were all quick to announce that they would list the new WorldCoin token WLD.

entry.title: Scaling Smart Wallets on Starknet 'Was The Winning Combination', Says Argent Co-Founder
entry.summary: Argent co-founder Julien Niset told Decrypt at EthCC Paris that he wants to make crypto wallets disappear. Or at least how they're currently conceived. From clunky seed phrases to a stiff user experience, Argent hopes to make using crypto a little less intimidating and a whole lot more fun.

entry.title: Sam Altman's Worldcoin Protocol Launches WLD Token on Optimism Mainnet
entry.summary: Described as “a massive leap for the entire project,” the Worldcoin milestone comes with World ID expansion and global Orb deployment plans.

entry.title: SEC Appeal Not a ‘Setback’ for Ripple XRP Ruling, Crypto Lawyer Says
entry.summary: The 'Torres Doctrine' is the law for at least two years, Crypto Law founder John Deaton writes.

entry.title: Scientists Discover 'Chemical Cocktails' That Reverse Aging
entry.summary: A group of researchers discovered six chemical compounds that could reverse aging, not just slow it.

entry.title: This Week on Crypto Twitter: Xi Jinping NFT Delisted from OpenSea
entry.summary: Also, a pair of crypto law experts tweeted their disappointment over recent crypto policy moves in Washington.

entry.title: Nevada Woman Sentenced for Hiring Hitman With Bitcoin to Kill Ex-Husband
entry.summary: Her $5,000 Bitcoin payment to a scam site would be worth $360,000 today.

entry.title: Elon Musk Confirms He'll Swap Twitter Logo for 'X' Tomorrow
entry.summary: The tech mogul said the Twitter logo will be cut off its San Francisco headquarters on Monday as the company pivots toward an "everything app."

entry.title: OpenSea-Backed Americana Makes Its 'Phygital' Vault Service Available to the Public
entry.summary: Both physical and digital assets can be securely stored and showcased. Here's how the "concierge vaulting" system works.

entry.title: Caitlin Long: The Fed Has Become an 'Unmovable Mountain'
entry.summary: The Custodia CEO says The Federal Reserve welcoming a European firm but not hers is "very un-American."

entry.title: SEC Asserts Ripple XRP Case was 'Wrongly Decided', Signals Appeal
entry.summary: Terra’s lawyers cited the Ripple XRP ruling in their latest filings, but the SEC says the ruling actually favors them.

entry.title: This Week in Coins: Bitcoin and Ethereum Dip as Chainlink, XRP, XLM Lead Growth
entry.summary: Also this week, the British treasury issued a firm no to those calling for crypto to be regulated as gambling.

entry.title: House Crypto Bill Won’t Restrain SEC and Could Threaten DeFi, Legal Experts Say
entry.summary: The House bill aims to give the crypto industry the regulatory clarity it's been waiting for, but legal experts say there’s reason to remain cautious.

entry.title: Why the Grammys Will Allow Songs Created With AI Help—At Least for Now
entry.summary: Recording Academy CEO Harvey Mason Jr. defends the move to allow AI-assisted music in Grammy nominations, but said there needs to be oversight.

entry.title: It's Time to Flip the Hollywood Script on Its Head
entry.summary: Amid strikes that have shut down Hollywood, Entertainmint CEO Genevieve Thiers argues that Film3 points the way to a more equitable path forward.

entry.title: OpenAI Brings ChatGPT to Android as AI Boom Continues
entry.summary: OpenAI wants to gain as many ChatGPT users as possible, and is going beyond web browsers by adding an Android app to its stable.

entry.title: Did You Miss Out on Hamster Races, Anon? HAMS Token Jumps 783%
entry.summary: Degens betting on the price of the HAMS token might be doing even better than degens betting crypto on the actual hamster races.

entry.title: Is Meta's ChatGPT Killer Really Open Source?
entry.summary: The Open Source Initiative told Meta’s Chief AI Scientist that the model they are promoting as Open Source is not really open source.

entry.title: OpenAI, Google, Microsoft Promise White House to Keep AI Safe
entry.summary: Industry leaders commit to safe, secure, and transparent development of artificial intelligence in agreement with the Biden administration.

entry.title: Fed Bent the Rules in Rollout of Instant Payment Service FedNow, Says Custodia CEO
entry.summary: Long pointed to public documents showing Adyen, a FedNow early adopter, got a federal master account in July 2020—a year before it had a U.S. branch.

entry.title: Human Artists Lose Ground in Legal Battle Against AI
entry.summary: U.S. District Judge William Orrick said artists should "provide more facts" to back up claims about alleged copyright infringement by AI companies

entry.title: FTX Lawsuit Alleges SBF Brother Planned to Turn Island Nation Into Doomsday Bunker
entry.summary: Gabriel Bankman-Fried allegedly planned to use Nauru as a shelter for effective altruists in the event of a global catastrophe.

entry.title: Bitfinex Hackers Agree to Forfeit Billions in Bitcoin in Plea Deal
entry.summary: Ilya Lichtenstein and his wife, Heather Morgan, will appear before a judge on August 3 and could face up to 20 years in prison.

entry.title: Welcome to McNuggets Land: McDonald’s Launches Metaverse Game in ‘The Sandbox’
entry.summary: McDonald’s is the latest major brand to debut an immersive metaverse game experience—with NFT and crypto rewards, too.

entry.title: Hackers Drain $3 Million in Ethereum From DeFi Protocol Conic Finance
entry.summary: The new DeFi protocol, which went live in March, has lost more than 1,700 Ethereum.

entry.title: Inside Mighty Action Heroes' Open Beta
entry.summary: Mighty Action Heroes is the flagship blockchain title from Mighty Bear Games. But is the browser-based battle royale shooter worth checking out? Decrypt's Kate Irwin offers her thoughts and a first look at the upcoming game.

entry.title: Dr. Disrespect's 'Deadrop': Early Access Gameplay From Snapshot VI
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin playtests Dr. Disrespect and Midnight Society's first-person shooter Deadrop and shares the latest game updates, as well as her opinions on the game in development. Currently, Deadrop offers Polygon Founders Pass NFTs with no other crypto plans revealed just yet.

entry.title: 'More and More' Game Publishers Will Embrace NFTs: Mythical Games CEO
entry.summary: In the wake of EA Sports and Fortnite creator Epic Games embracing Nike's NFT platform, Mythical Games CEO John Linden tells Decrypt's Andrew Hayward how quickly he expects to see more major traditional game publishers enter the blockchain space and how quickly the industry will scale.

entry.title: Gran Saga Unlimited Early Access: Inside the Anime MMORPG on Aptos
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin plays Gran Saga: Unlimited's second community playtest, reports her findings, and offers her opinion and insights on the upcoming game, which will offer optional Aptos NFTs.

entry.title: 100 Thieves' Moe Says Blockchain Games Will 'Eventually' Be Accepted by Livestreamers
entry.summary: 100 Thieves content creator and gamer Moe also goes by "Yassuo" online after his favorite League of Legends character. Decrypt's Kate Irwin asks him about 100 Thieves' future crypto plans and whether Moe thinks creators like xQc and Pokimane might ever come around to blockchain games.

entry.title: "Games of the Future Are Going to Be Different," Says Splinterlands Cofounder
entry.summary: Splinterlands Cofounder Matt Rosen tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about how the game has evolved over its five-year history and why he doesn't listen to the FUD around crypto.

entry.title: Inside Champions Ascension: Like 'For Honor' with NFTs?
entry.summary: Plai Labs Marketing Director Payton Kaleiwahea tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about player response to the combat game Champions Ascension in development, which offers arena combat, raid bosses, AI landscape features, and more.

entry.title: Ex-Activision VP Michael Lee: Gaming Is Crypto's 'Killer App'
entry.summary: Former Activision Vice President Michael Lee is now the SVP of Growth at Matter Labs. At the 3XP gaming conference, Lee sat down with Decrypt's Kate Irwin to discuss crypto gaming and give his predictions for the industry.

entry.title: Behind the Scenes with AMGI Studios and My Pet Hooligan
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin goes to Burbank, California for a behind-the-scenes tour of AMGI Studios, the developers of upcoming game My Pet Hooligan.

entry.title: Why Legend of Arcadia Chose Sui Over EVM Chains
entry.summary: Legend of Arcadia Executive Producer Andy Lee tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about the game and why they switched from EVM to new protocol Sui.

entry.title: Rumble Racing Star Game Preview: Is This Mario Kart With NFTs?
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin shares a first look at Delabs' upcoming lawn mower racing game Rumble Racing Star, which offers a large cast of quirky characters pulled from the worlds of Bored Ape Yacht Club, Pudgy Penguins, and more.

entry.title: Why Laguna Games Turned Down 'Game of Thrones' for Crypto Unicorns
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin chats with Laguna Games about why the team chose to move away from an offer with WB Games to develop a Game of Thrones licensed title—and made Crypto Unicorns instead.

entry.title: Mythical Games CEO John Linden on NFL Rivals Topping 1M Downloads
entry.summary: Mythical Games just raised a $37 million Series C1 round on the back of the early success of NFL Rivals, which has already topped a million downloads in two months. Mythical CEO John Linden joins Decrypt's Andrew Hayward to discuss the launch and impact of NFL Rivals.

entry.title: How Ava Labs Is Approaching Gaming on Avalanche
entry.summary: At 3XP, Ava Labs Head of Gaming Ed Chang sat down with Decrypt's Kate Irwin to discuss some of the biggest Avalanche-based games on the horizon and how the company is approaching and thinking about Web3 gaming.

entry.title: Ogimi Founder David Gull on Why AI Should Be Your Meditation Coach
entry.summary: Ogimi founder David Gull speaks with Decrypt's Jason Nelson about its AI-driven meditation guides and how the technology can enable a more unique, custom-tailored meditation experience for users.
